description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
name: accessibility

fields.description: Total score of this category.
fields.name: total_score

fields.description: Adding ways to bypass repetitive content lets keyboard users navigate the page more efficiently. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/bypass?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: bypass_repetitive_content

fields.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/color-contrast?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: color_contrast

fields.description: The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/title).
fields.name: document_title_found

fields.descrition: The value of an id attribute must be unique to prevent other instances from being overlooked by assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/duplicate-id?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: no_duplicate_id_attribute

fields.description: If a page doesn't specify a lang attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/html-lang?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: html_has_lang_attribute

fields.description: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) helps screen readers announce text properly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/valid-lang?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: html_lang_is_valid

fields.description: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/image-alt?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: images_have_alt_attribute

fields.description: Labels ensure that form controls are announced properly by assistive technologies, like screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/label?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: form_elements_have_labels

fields.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/link-name?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: links_have_names

fields.description: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/list?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: lists_are_well_formed

fields.description: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>` or `<ol>` to be announced properly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/listitem?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: list_items_within_proper_parents

fields.description: Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/meta-viewport?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: meta_viewport_allows_zoom

fields.description: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-allowed-attr?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_allowed_attr

fields.description: Some ARIA roles have required attributes that describe the state of the element to screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-required-attr?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_required_attr

fields.description: Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-required-children?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_required_children

fields.description: Some ARIA child roles must be contained by specific parent roles to properly perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-required-parent?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_required_parent

fields.description: ARIA roles must have valid values in order to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-roles?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_roles

fields.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-valid-attr-value?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_valid_attr_value

fields.description: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid names. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/aria-valid-attr?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: aria_valid_attr

fields.description: A table being used for layout purposes should not include data elements, such as the th or caption elements or the summary attribute, because this can create a confusing experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/layout-table?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: layout_table

fields.description: When a button doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it as "button", making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/button-name?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: button_name

fields.description: Screen reader users rely on frame titles to describe the contents of frames. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/frame-title?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: frame_title

fields.description: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) on elements helps ensure that text is pronounced correctly by a screen reader. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/valid-lang?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: valid_lang

fields.description: A value greater than 0 implies an explicit navigation ordering. Although technically valid, this often creates frustrating experiences for users who rely on assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/tabindex?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: tabindex

fields.description: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring `<td>` cells using the `[headers]` attribute only refer to other cells in the same table may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/td-headers-attr?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: td_headers_attr

fields.description: Total score of this category.
fields.name: total_score

fields.description: Application Cache is deprecated. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/appcache).
fields.name: avoid_application_cache

fields.description: All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data. HTTPS prevents intruders from tampering with or passively listening in on the communications between your app and your users, and is a prerequisite for HTTP/2 and many new web platform APIs. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/https).
fields.name: uses_https

fields.description: HTTP/2 offers many benefits over HTTP/1.1, including binary headers, multiplexing, and server push. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http2).
fields.name: uses_http2

fields.description: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/passive-event-listeners).
fields.name: uses_passive_event_listeners

fields.description: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/document-write).
fields.name: no_document_write

fields.description: Add rel="noopener" or rel="noreferrer" to any external links to improve performance and prevent security vulnerabilities. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/noopener).
fields.name: external_anchors_use_rel_noopener

fields.description: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request their location without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/geolocation-on-load).
fields.name: no_geolocation_on_start

fields.description: Specifying a doctype prevents the browser from switching to quirks-mode.Read more on the [MDN Web Docs page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Doctype)
fields.name: doctype_defined

fields.description: Some third-party scripts may contain known security vulnerabilities that are easily identified and exploited by attackers. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/vulnerabilities).
fields.name: no_vulnerable_libraries

fields.description: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request to send notifications without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/notifications-on-load).
fields.name: notification_asked_on_start

fields.description: Deprecated APIs will eventually be removed from the browser. [Learn more](https://www.chromestatus.com/features#deprecated).
fields.name: avoid_deprecated_apis

fields.description: Preventing password pasting undermines good security policy. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/password-pasting).
fields.name: allow_paste_to_password_field

fields.description: Errors logged to the console indicate unresolved problems. They can come from network request failures and other browser concerns.
fields.name: errors_in_console

fields.description: Image display dimensions should match natural aspect ratio. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/aspect-ratio).
fields.name: images_have_correct_aspect_ratio

fields.description: All front-end JavaScript libraries detected on the page.
fields.name: js_libraries

fields.description: Application Cache is deprecated. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/appcache).
fields.name: appcache_manifest

fields.description: Total score of this category.
fields.name: total_score

fields.description: First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-contentful-paint).
fields.name: first_contentful_paint

fields.description: First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-meaningful-paint).
fields.name: first_meaningful_paint

fields.description: Largest Contentful Paint marks the time at which the largest text or image is painted. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-largest-contentful-paint/)
fields.name: largest_contentful_paint

fields.description: Sum of all time periods between FCP and Time to Interactive, when task length exceeded 50ms, expressed in milliseconds. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-total-blocking-time/).
fields.name: total_blocking_time

fields.description: The maximum potential First Input Delay that your users could experience is the duration of the longest task. [Learn more](https://web.dev/lighthouse-max-potential-fid/).
fields.name: max_potential_fid

fields.description: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/speed-index).
fields.name: speed_index

fields.description: Interactive marks the time at which the page is fully interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/consistently-interactive).
fields.name: interactive

fields.description: First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-interactive).
fields.name: first_cpu_idle

description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App, as specified by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
name: pwa

fields.description: Total score of this category.
fields.name: total_score

fields.description: A fast page load over a 3G network ensures a good mobile user experience. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/fast-3g).
fields.name: load_fast_enough

fields.description: If you're building a Progressive Web App, consider using a service worker so that your app can work offline. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http-200-when-offline).
fields.name: works_offline

fields.description: Browsers can proactively prompt users to add your app to their homescreen, which can lead to higher engagement. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/install-prompt).
fields.name: installable_manifest

fields.description: All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data. HTTPS prevents intruders from tampering with or passively listening in on the communications between your app and your users, and is a prerequisite for HTTP/2 and many new web platform APIs. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/https).
fields.name: uses_https

fields.description: If you've already set up HTTPS, make sure that you redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http-redirects-to-https).
fields.name: redirects_http_to_https

fields.description: Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/has-viewport-meta-tag).
fields.name: has_meta_viewport

fields.description: The service worker is the technology that enables your app to use many Progressive Web App features, such as offline, add to homescreen, and push notifications. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/registered-service-worker).
fields.name: uses_service_worker

fields.description: Your app should display some content when JavaScript is disabled, even if it's just a warning to the user that JavaScript is required to use the app. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/no-js).
fields.name: works_without_javascript

fields.description: A themed splash screen ensures a high-quality experience when users launch your app from their homescreens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/custom-splash-screen).
fields.name: splash_screen_found

fields.description: The browser address bar can be themed to match your site. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/address-bar).
fields.name: themed_address_bar

fields.description: If the width of your app's content doesn't match the width of the viewport, your app might not be optimized for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/content-sized-correctly-for-viewport).
fields.name: content_width

description: These checks ensure that your page is optimized for search engine results ranking. There are additional factors Lighthouse does not check that may affect your search ranking. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
name: seo

fields.description: Total score of this category.
fields.name: total_score

fields.description: Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/has-viewport-meta-tag).
fields.name: has_meta_viewport

fields.description: The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/title).
fields.name: document_title_found

fields.description: Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/description).
fields.name: meta_description

fields.description: Pages with unsuccessful HTTP status codes may not be indexed properly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/successful-http-code).
fields.name: http_status_code

fields.description: Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/descriptive-link-text).
fields.name: descriptive_link_text

fields.description: Search engines are unable to include your pages in search results if they don't have permission to crawl them. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/indexing).
fields.name: is_crawlable

fields.description: If your robots.txt file is malformed, crawlers may not be able to understand how you want your website to be crawled or indexed.
fields.name: robots_txt_valid

fields.description: hreflang links tell search engines what version of a page they should list in search results for a given language or region. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/hreflang).
fields.name: hreflang_valid

fields.description: Font sizes less than 12px are too small to be legible and require mobile visitors to “pinch to zoom” in order to read. Strive to have >60% of page text ≥12px. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/font-sizes).
fields.name: font_size_ok

fields.description: Search engines can't index plugin content, and many devices restrict plugins or don't support them. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/plugins).
fields.name: plugins_ok

fields.description: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.1/image-alt?application=lighthouse).
fields.name: image_alt

fields.description: Canonical links suggest which URL to show in search results. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/canonical).
fields.name: valid_rel_canonical

fields.description: Interactive elements like buttons and links should be large enough (48x48px), and have enough space around them, to be easy enough to tap without overlapping onto other elements. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/accessible-styles#multi-device_responsive_design).
fields.name: tap_targets

fields.description: Run the [Structured Data Testing Tool](https://search.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool/) and the [Structured Data Linter](http://linter.structured-data.org/) to validate structured data. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/docs/guides/mark-up-content).
fields.name: structured_data
